reason: In vivo single-unit electrophysiology in rats is present.

header.title: Spike-based coupling between single neurons and populations across rat sensory cortices, perirhinal cortex, and hippocampus
header.authors: Reinder Dorman, Jeroen J. Bos, Martin A. Vinck, Pietro Marchesi, Julien Fiorilli, Jeanette A.M. Lorteije, Ingrid Reiten, Jan G. Bjaalie, Michael Okun, Cyriel M.A. Pennartz

data_description.brain_region: S1BF (somatosensory cortex), V1 (visual cortex), PER (perirhinal cortex), CA1 (hippocampus)
data_description.behavioral_condition: Active wakefulness during task performance and sleep
data_description.behavioral_task: Two-choice visual discrimination task on a figure-8 maze

spike_level.unit_inclusion_thresholds: Clusters accepted when inter-spike interval of 2 ms was contaminated with < 0.1% of total spike count; minimum of 3 cells per session and area for inclusion
spike_level.temporal_binning_filters: Spiking activity extracted from bandpass filtered (600–6,000 Hz) signals, digitized at 3 kHz; cross-correlation for SNPC analysis
spike_level.computed_metrics: Single-neuron population coupling (SNPC), Z-scored to shuffled distribution, peak/trough analysis, explained variance for decoding, firing rate, waveform shape, cell type classification (FS interneurons, pyramidal cells)
spike_level.stat_controls: Kruskal–Wallis test, Wilcoxon’s signed-rank and rank sum tests, Bonferroni correction, bootstrapping (1,000 iterations), Freedman-Diaconis’ method for binning

spatial_level.frm_bin_size_coord: Maze segmented into 51 equally sized spatial bins (~9 cm each)
spatial_level.spatial_metrics: Spatial selectivity, correlation of SNPC with spatial coding
spatial_level.object_cue_related: Visual and tactile cues used in behavioral task; visual discrimination of CS+ and CS− stimuli

population_level.correlation_measures: Spearman’s rank correlation, Pearson’s correlation, cross-correlation of single unit with population activity
population_level.dimensionality_reduction: Dimensionality reduction techniques mentioned but not systematically used for SNPC profile description
population_level.clustering: Automated and manual spike clustering based on waveform peak amplitude, energy, and first derivative of energy
population_level.decoding_prediction: Decoding of reference cell’s spiking activity from population rates; explained variance analysis
population_level.synchrony_assembly: Analysis of broadcasting index (number of areas a single cell is significantly coupled with); analysis of synchrony between single neurons and populations

temporal_network.cross_correlation: Cross-correlation of single unit activity with summed population activity within and between areas
temporal_network.network_metrics: Broadcasting Index (BI), analysis of within- and between-area coupling, meta-network structure
